meanings.sent1: After some time, the knife blade needed to be resharpened.
meanings.sent2: The pencil point broke, so it had to be resharpened.
meanings.sent3: The chef comically resharpened the already sharp knife, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her focus resharpened as she prepared for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The image on the screen slowly resharpened into focus.

meanings.sent1: He resharpened the dull scissors to make them usable again.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith resharpened the sword to prepare for battle.
meanings.sent3: The barber resharpened his scissors with a dramatic flair.
meanings.sent4: Her wit resharpened as she engaged in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The memory resharpened his grief as he visited the old house.
